etymologies: late 16th century (in the sense ‘boil (fruit) gently’): origin uncertain; coddle (sense 1) is probably a dialect variant of obsolete caudle ‘administer invalids' gruel’, based on Latin caldum ‘hot drink’, from calidus ‘warm’

definitions: treat in an indulgent or overprotective way
shortDefinitions: treat someone in indulgent or overprotective way

synonyms.text: wait on someone hand and foot

definitions: cook (an egg) in water below boiling point

examples.text: you may have your eggs scrambled, poached, coddled, or boiled

shortDefinitions: cook egg in water below boiling point
